greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: n-th prime prime(n) written in base (prime(n) (mod 4)).
link: Michael De Vlieger, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..168
example: 4k+1 primes are written in base 1, while 4k+3 primes are in base 3.
mathematica: Table[FromDigits@ If[#2 == 1, ConstantArray[1, #1], IntegerDigits[#1, #2]] & @@ {#, Mod[#, 4]} &@ Prime@ w, {w, 17}] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Sep 04 2019 *)
program: (PARI) a(n) = {my(p=prime(n)); if ((p % 4) != 1, fromdigits(digits(p, p % 4), 10), fromdigits(vector(p, k, 1), 10));} \\ _Michel Marcus_, Sep 04 2019
results.author: _Labos Elemer_, Jul 12 2002
